structural_unit_name.en: School of Theology and Religious Studies

description.en:
*    Methodological limits of interviewing
*    Types of interviews
*    Individual and group interviews 
*    The principles preparing an interview plan
*    Establishing and maintaining contact. Guidelines for conducting research interviews.
*    Pilot interview and transcription
*    Coding interviews. Analytical tools and presentation of results.
description.et:
*	Intervjueerimise metodoloogilised piirid. 
*	Intervjuude liigid. 
*	Individuaal ja grupiintervjuu
*	Intervjuu juhendi koostamise printsiibid
*	Kontakti loomine ja ülalhoidmine. Intervjueerimise põhimõtted
*	Prooviintervjuu ja transkriptsioon.  
*	Intervjuude kodeerimine.  Analüüsivahendid ja tulemuste esitamine.

objectives.en: The aim of this course is to introduce different approaches for interviewing and get experience in practicing them with the focus on students' own research aims
objectives.et: Kursuse eesmärk on tutvustada ja rakendada intervjueerimise eri viise ning saada kogemusi nende praktiliseks kasutamiseks oma uurimistöö eesmärke silmas pidades

learning_outcomes.en: By the end of the course the student:
*    constructs and critically evaluates an interview plan geared toward the respective research question.
learning_outcomes.et: *   Koostab ja hindab kriitiliselt oma uurimisküsimusest lähtuvalt intervjuu plaani

learning_outcomes.en: *    uses main interviewing techniques and applies them in compliance with set research aim.
learning_outcomes.et: *   Valdab peamisi intervjueerimistehnikaid ning kasutab neid oma uurimiseesmärgile vastavalt

learning_outcomes.en: *    conducts a pilot interview and based on it modifies interview questions and technique.
learning_outcomes.et: *   Viib läbi prooviintervjuu ning kohandab selle põhjal oma intervjuuküsimusi ja -tehnikat

learning_outcomes.en: *    transcribes the interview in a way what helpis to achieve the aims of the research
learning_outcomes.et: *   Koostab intervjuu transkriptsiooni viisil, mis toetab tema uuringu eesmärke
*   Omab ülevaadet erinevatest analüüsitehnikatest. Kasutab üleskirjutuses asjakohast kodeerimist

description.et: Oma uurimisküsimusest lähtuva intervjuu juhendi koostamine ja kriitiline hindamine
Prooviintervjuu läbiviimine, kasutades sobivaid intervjueerimise tehnikaid, oma tegevuse analüüs
2 lk prooviintervjuu transkriptsiooni viisil, mis toetab püstitatud uuringu eesmärke
Osalemine seminarides / või kirjalikult loetud artikli kokkuvõte puudud seminari teemal

resources.mandatory_materials:
Handouts
Mats Alvesson. (2003, Jan) Beyond Neopositivists, Romantics, and Localists: A Reflexive Approach to Interviews in Organizational Research. In: The Academy of Management Review, Vol. 28, No. 1, pp. 13-33

Clare Butler. (2014) Making interview transcripts real: the reader's response. In Work, employment and society: A Journal of the British Sociological Association. (doi: 10.1177/0950017014523482 )

Rubin & Rubin. (2004). Qualitative interviewing: The art of hearing data. Thousand Oaks, CA. Sage Publications. (also online)

Jacqueline A Belzile and Gunilla Oberg (2012) Where to begin? Grappling with how to use participant interaction in focus group design. In: Qualitative Research, 12/4 p. 459-472
resources.recommended_materials:
Mats Alvesson. (2011) Interpreting Interviews. SAGE Publications Ltd (e-raamatuna)
Briggs, CL. (1986). Learning how to ask: A sociolinguistic appraisal of the role of the interview in social science research. Cambridge University Press.
Katja Vähäsantanen & Jaana Saarinen. (2013) The power dance in the research interview: manifesting power and powerlessness. IN: Qualitative Research, October 2013; vol. 13, 5: pp. 493-510.
Charles L. Briggs (2007, Aug). Anthropology, Interviewing, and Communicability in Contemporary Society. In: Current Anthropology, Vol. 48, No. 4, pp. 551-580.
Gubrium, JA, & Holstein, JA. (2001). Handbook of interview Research: Context and Method. Thousand Oaks, CA. Sage Publications. (ka võrgus)

description.et: General theoretical introduction: Methodological limits of the interview, different ways to understand the interview. Typology of interviews. Planning the interview questions and design
a) Discussion of the interview plans b) Pilot interview   b) Transcription c) Coding procedure I
a) Discussion of transcriptions b) Coding procedure II c) Group interviews and other relevant issues
Coding procedures. Analytical tools and presentation of results

audience.et: Doctoral students who are planning to use qualitative interviews in their research
